body_html:
I agree cuDNN is important, but that I think it should be independent?
i.e., this is important for CPU platforms as well.

William Chan
Carnegie Mellon University
(650) 450-9455
williamchan.ca

On Wed, Apr 20, 2016 at 6:05 PM, Vijay Vasudevan notifications@github.com
wrote:

We'd like to make sure this is compatible with cudnn's LSTM implementation
and API, but that will take some time to test and validate, and this is an
awesome op to have. So in the meantime, can you move this code to
tensorflow/contrib/rnn/ ?

See some of the other examples of custom C++ ops in contrib/ for how to
pattern your files and tests and imports. Thanks!

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
#2002 (comment)

body:
I agree cuDNN is important, but that I think it should be independent?
i.e., this is important for CPU platforms as well.

## 

William Chan
Carnegie Mellon University
(650) 450-9455
williamchan.ca
